incidents.name: WhatsApp Outbound Messages Failing with Error Code 63005

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing 63005 errors when sending outbound WhatsApp messages. This incident has been resolved.

We are observing recovery from the issue causing 63005 errors when sending outbound WhatsApp messages.  We will continue to monitor to ensure full service recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
We are continuing to investigate the issue causing 63005 errors when sending outbound WhatsApp messages.  We will provide an update in 2 hours or as soon as more information is available.

Since December 31, 2024, Twilio has noticed a higher occurrence of 63005 errors when sending outbound WhatsApp messages, confirmed by Meta to be an internal WhatsApp issue where Twilio receives an unexpected error code (135000) when sending the message to Meta servers. The root cause has been identified by Meta and their team is working on a fix with Twilio supporting.  We will provide an update in 1 hour or as soon as we have more information.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with outbound WhatsApp messages failing. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Automated Alert: No Customer Impact

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the issue causing errors when creating or updating TwiML applications that was triggered by our automated alerting system.  It was determined that there is no noticeable customer impact at this time. All systems are operational, and we will file a retroactive incident shortly.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with TwiML application creation via the API and console. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Attempts to Create and Update TwiML Applications via the Console and REST API Failed with 5xx Errors

incident_updates.body: Twilio TwiML Applications were degraded for approximately 12 minutes between 7 January 4:48PM PDT and 7 January 5:00PM PDT. During this period of time, customers who attempted to create or update TwiML applications, both via the REST API and Console, may have experienced HTTP 5XX errors preventing their actions from succeeding. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to Multiple Networks in Colombia

incident_updates.body: SMS Delivery Delays to Multiple Networks in Columbia, service was degraded for 14 minutes from 13:25 to 13:57 Pacific Time on Dec 26, 2024.  During this period of time customers may have experienced SMS Delivery Delays in Columbia. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Reports Delays to DigiTel C.A. in Venezuela (Bolivarian Republic of) via Subset of Pre-Registered Sender ID.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to Telstra and Vodafone Networks in Australia

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Telstra and Vodafone Networks in Australia. This incident has been resolved.

We are observing recovery in SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Telstra and Vodafone Networks in Australia. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
